pullrequest.title: Added multicamera sensor to support synchronized stereo cameras

content.raw:
Brian, while we're discussing stereo:
The policy with the PR2 stereo (which I heavily use) is to publish stereo images on two seperate channels. 
This then requires using stereo_image_proc to re-sync them so as to process them together.

Given the data is published by the same process and it perfectly synced on transmit, why do this? 
Is there a ROS REP that decided this?

In our LCM world we simply created an image array message containing n images
